Having been isolated for some time within the confines of MegatronX's stock=
ade, keep hidden from those who inhabited this world for now. A reborn Dece=
pticon remained ever vigilant and observant of all that happened... from af=
ar. Eager to surprise some of the occupants. 

Crimson optics flashed upon =
receiving data that her old opponent and archrival Elita-One still function=
ed... and was here upon this very world. A deep animal-metallic gurgle-grow=
l eminated from her as she took note of the last location of Elita. 

"So,"=
 she began softly. "You've managed to escape the throws of the Abyss, have =
you." Baring her razored metallic teeth, "Not for long, to be sure of that!=
" she hissed maliciously. 

A clawed finger touched another 'button' on the=
 console and another holographic visual appeared of Hydras' signature and s=
ignatures of others before they faded out in some vast area of the unknown.=
 A dangerous area. 
"Hmmm," tapping and typing, still nothing seemed to wor=
k. But there was one hint, so very tiny and barely readable of some signatu=
re for but a split moment. 

It appeared she will have to make herself know=
n soon enough. Surprise her former allies and enemies. No one would expect =
her return. 
And so, she powered up on an alternative energon that was deri=
ved from geo-thermal energy. It was not a delightful as the Cybertronian ve=
rsion, but it would serve it's purpose very well and was more than tolerabl=
e. 

Once powered up now at full power, she exited the compound, with or wi=
thout MegatronX's permission. It was time to make her presence here known. =

Leaping off a ledge she transformed into a massively majestic Cybertronian=
 vessel of destruction... and took to the sky.
